summary: Feature request to help catch use-before-define bugs when imperative APIs for signals and queries are defined after workflow start time. Proposes warning logs in development and/or buffering signals until handlers are registered.
userImpact: Users may accidentally define signal or query handlers after workflow start, causing signals to be lost or queries to fail, but lack visibility into this bug.
rootCause: Imperative dynamic API allows signals and queries to be defined after workflow start time, creating a window where messages arrive before handlers exist.
proposedFix: Buffer signals until a listener is registered; queue them for delivery when the handler is defined. For queries, ensure they're registered before invocation or return an error.
resolutionDetails: Implementation decided to buffer signals until listener is registered and require queries to be registered before invocation.
keyQuote: We're buffering signals until a listener is registered. Queries must be registered before invoked or the caller will get an error.
